newsitem.title: GERMANY: German call softens slightly in liquid market.
newsitem.headline: German call softens slightly in liquid market.

text.p: German call money rates eased back slightly to a 3.00 to 3.05 percent range on Tuesday as liquidity levels remained good, dealers said.
After trading at around 3.05 on Friday, rates softened in the wake of data showing daily reserves held at the Bundesbank rose to 41.5 billion marks on Friday from 40.9 on Thursday.

Call money was likely to remain stable in the coming sessions, traders said, with the Bundesbank expected to fully replace the 85.9 billion mark repo facility, due for expiry on Wednesday, with a new 14-day tender set earlier.

Central bank figures showed that average reserves held by commercial banks dropped slightly to 40.6 billion marks on Friday from from 40.9 previously, while borrowing on the emergency Lombard faicility was negligible.
German markets were closed on Monday for a bank holiday.
The Frankfurt Interbank Overnight Average (FIONA) was quoted at 3.07533 percent on Tuesday versus 3.08867 on Friday.
